intro: Chirita carnosifolia, commonly known as the fat-leaved violet, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that store water, adapting it to arid environments. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of pink, purple, and white, often blooming in spring and summer. It is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care. Chirita carnosifolia prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
